meanings.definition: A person who is colorblind and can only see shades of gray.
meanings.sent1: The monochromat struggled to distinguish between the different colors of the traffic lights.
meanings.sent2: The doctor confirmed that he was a monochromat after conducting a series of color vision tests.
meanings.sent3: The monochromat joked that they had a 'black and white' wardrobe to match their vision.
meanings.sent4: In a world of vibrant hues, the monochromat felt like a character in a grayscale movie.
meanings.sent5: The monochromat's world was like an old black-and-white photograph, devoid of color.

meanings.definition: A device or image that displays or consists of only one color.
meanings.sent1: The computer monitor showed a monochromat image in black and white.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a striking monochromat painting using only shades of blue.
meanings.sent3: The monochromat display on the screen made it easier for the user to focus on text.
meanings.sent4: The simplicity of the monochromat logo made it instantly recognizable.
meanings.sent5: The monochromat design of the room gave it a modern and minimalist feel.
